title: Brooch, "Kul Oba", ca. 1875
markings: On reverse: Interlocked Cs in diamond form
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Susan Dwight Bliss, Annie Schermerhorn Kane, and various donors
description:
Large gold pendant broach with circular top, arched section below from which hang 11 vase-shaped pendants.  Fine gold granulation work throughout.

The design of this brooch, like some other pieces made by the Castellanis, is based closely on jewelery unearthed at an important archeological site at Kol Oba in Southern Russia, discovered in 1830.  Drawings of the jewels, which date from the 4th century BCE, were published after their transferal to the Hermitage in St. Petersburg.

exhibitions.title: Nancy and Edwin Marks Collection Gallery: Treasures from the Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Brooch, "Kul Oba", ca. 1875.
ca. 1875. Gold. Museum purchase through gift of Susan Dwight Bliss, Annie Schermerhorn Kane, and various donors. 1969-40-41.
